newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian ATX steams to record high,seen correcting.
newsitem.headline: Austrian ATX steams to record high,seen correcting.

text.p: Austria's ATX index .ATX of 21 blue chips surged to a record high for the fourth day running on Thursday, adding on 16.65 points, or 1.22 percent, to 1,381.4.
Among its constituents 13 shares rose and eight fell.
But traders said the peak may have been reached as trading volume was below Wednesday's levels.
"The ATX may have reached its year high today. I think we're going to come gently down now," said one trader.
Traders traced today's gains above all to engineering group VA Tech, which rose 5.36 percent to 2,520 schillings on turnover of nearly 47,000 lots.
"The main reason for the rally was VA Tech strength," said another trader. "Only when VA Tech rose the others were bought."
The ATX performance was relatively disappointing in early trade, when the German Dax was already making clear gains, he added.
The top gainer was beverage group BBAG, which jumped 6.88 percent to 823 schillings.
The leading decliner was fibre producer Lenzing, dropping 1.51 percent to 717 schillings.
The July ATX future climbed 18.6 points to 1,389.1 with 831 contracts traded.
